metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18641 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In LXC 2.0, many template scripts download code over cleartext HTTP, and omit a digital-signature check, before running it to bootstrap containers.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18641` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblxc-common - 3.0.4-0ubuntu2
liblxc1 - 3.0.4-0ubuntu2
libpam-cgfs - 3.0.4-0ubuntu2
lxc - 3.0.4-0ubuntu2
lxc-utils - 3.0.4-0ubuntu2
lxc1 - 3.0.4-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> in lxc 3.0, the old templates were split out into the lxc-templates package and distrobuilder is now used instead. https://github.com/lxc/lxc/commit/aafb5ea2a849056f9866359996605af0290605bd  as of 2020-05-13, no complete fix for the issues are available rodrigo-zaiden> as of 2022-03-09, there is still no complete fix.

criterions.comment: lxc package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.4-0ubuntu2').
lxc-templates package in focal is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
